2054.subject: HPWE
2054.descrlong: Development of Internal Power - a short Yang style energy form. A simple but yet powerful form of Yang style Tai Chi, Tai Chi Chi Kung I teaches the principles of body mechanics through the alignment of the bone structure with the force of gravity. This course will present the Taoist principles and deep, internal work necessary for the effective practice of any form of Tai Chi. Credit/no credit option. (Offered as interest warrants.)

2063.subject: HPWE

A simple but yet powerful form of Yang style Tai Chi, Tai Chi Chi Kung I teaches the principles of body mechanics through the alignment of the bone structure with the force of gravity. This course will present the Taoist principles and deep, internal work necessary for the effective practice of any form of Tai Chi. Credit/no credit option. (Offered as interest warrants.)

2064.subject: HPWE
2064.descrlong: Teaches two Taiji (Tai Chi) short forms starting with a Sun Style 12 movement form. Contains qigong exercises to enhance healing and agile steps to improve mobility, especially beneficial for arthritis or beginners.  Following Development of Internal Power, a short Yang-style  energy form of Tai Chi Chi Kung I teaches the principles of body mechanics through the alignment of the bone structure with the force of gravity.  Emphasizes taoist principles and deep internal work necessary for the effective practice of any form of Taiji.  Credit/no credit option. (Offered every semester.)

2071.subject: HPWE
2071.descrlong: Teaches two Taiji (Tai Chi) short forms starting with a Sun Style 12 movement form. Contains qigong exercises to enhance healing and agile steps to improve mobility, especially beneficial for arthritis or beginners.  Following Development of Internal Power, a short Yang-style  energy form of Tai Chi Chi Kung I teaches the principles of body mechanics through the alignment of the bone structure with the force of gravity.  Emphasizes taoist principles and deep internal work necessary for the effective practice of any form of Taiji.  Credit/no credit option. (Offered every semester.)

2072.subject: HPWE
2072.descrlong: Short Sun Style form (especially beneficial for arthritis) contains powerful qigong exercises to enhance healing and agile steps to improve mobility.  Develops better balance and flexibility.  Second form emphasizes the Development of Internal Power, a simple Yang style Tai Chi Chi Kung I form that teaches the principles of body mechanics through the alignment of the bone structure with the force of gravity.  Explains theory and provides training for deep internal work necessary for effective practice of any form of Tai Chi.  (Offered every semester.)
